flawed_nl_solution:
His new computer uses 800*0.5=<<800*0.5=4000>>4000 watts more than his old computer
So it users 800+4000=<<800+4000=4800>>4800 watts
That is 4800/1000=<<4800/1000=4.8>>4.8 kw
Electricity cost 12*0.25=<<12*0.25=3>>3 cents more than it used to
So it now cost 12+3=<<12+3=15>>15 cents per kwh
He used 4.8*50=<<4.8*50=240>>240 kwh
So he paid 15*240=<<15*240=3600>>3600 cents per kwh
So he paid 3600/100=$<<3600/100=36>>36
#### 36

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 400, not 4000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
